title: Centre unveils 184 ‘climate-resilient’ seed varieties to boost output
content: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan says India has overtaken China as the world’s largest producer of rice, he defends the new rural employment Bill and says it is a ‘better scheme’ than MGNREGA

title: Satheesan to present blueprint for Congress poll campaign at party camp on Monday
content: As per the plan, conceived with the help of poll strategist Sunil Kanagolu, candidates will be declared in two phases. K.C. Venugopal asks party leaders to refrain from declaring themselves as candidates

title: Fifteen years on, 36 accused in Paravur sexual exploitation case still at large
content: Trial of six accused in case is set to begin on Monday. The trial court has acquitted 13 accused as the survivor reportedly turned hostile or failed to identify them

title: Chitra Santhe reflects Karnataka’s cultural ethos: CM Siddaramaiah
content: Chitra Santhe, an annual open-air art fair organised by the Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath, draws artists and visitors from across the country

title: Mortal remains of Punjab man who died in Russia-Ukraine war brought back
content: The older brother of the deceased Mandeep Kumar appealed to the Union Government to take appropriate steps to prevent recruitment of Indians in the Russian army

title: VACB recommends CBI investigation against Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan for FCRA violation
content: Recommendations based on its findings that Satheesan may have violated the Foreign Currency Regulation Act, (FCRA) 2010, by marshalling foreign funds through U.K.-based charity foundations, ostensibly to rehabilitate 2018 flood victims in his constituency in Paravur, Ernakulam

title: Congress turning Ballari into ‘republic’ of Bharath Reddy, says Joshi
content: The Union Minister seeks the arrest of Ballari City MLA for ‘being the reason behind’ the recent clash

title: Kogilu Layout evictions: Organisations place demand before govt. during public meeting
content: The demands include permanent rehabilitation for the evicted families, issuance of property deeds or occupancy certificates to rehabilitated families, temporary arrangements for basic facilities at the demolition site, and an assurance that the evicted families will not be forced to move from the area

title: Narayana lays stone for school being set up by Waqf Board in Nellore
content: Said to be the first such institution, it is meant to meet the educational needs of the marginalised sections of society

title: Congress govt.’s appeasement policy nurturing traitors, says Vijayendra
content: BJP State president says this Siddaramaiah-led government is dysfunctional, after visiting murder victim’s family in Yellapur

title: Rahul Mamkootathil rape case survivor submits fresh complaint against Rahul Easwar
content: Complaint alleges that he violated bail conditions and created circumstances for further cyber harassment

title: No monkeying around: Animals inside some Bengaluru’s Namma Metro stations worry commuters
content: Experts say to prevent monkeys and other urban wildlife from entering metro stations, it’s essential to eliminate all food sources in and around these areas

title: Ankita murder case: Opposition parties protest, demand CBI probe as police rules out ‘VIP’ angle
content: During the protest, opposition party workers held placards with slogans like "Give justice to Ankita", "No more delays, surround the Chief Minister," and raised anti-government slogans

title: Goa club fire victims’ kin protest at Jantar Mantar, seek death row for Luthra brothers
content: Raising slogans such as “hang the killers”, the protesters named brothers Saurabh Luthra and Gaurav Luthra, holding them responsible for the blaze that claimed 25 lives

title: Registration department has set benchmark in transparency, says CM
content: Highlighting its role beyond revenue, the Chief Minister says the department safeguards citizens’ property rights and legal security, making it a key pillar in the state’s development

title: Ex-Mumbai Mayor Shubha Raul Quits Shiv Sena, Joins BJP
content: In a blow to the Shiv Sena (UBT) ahead of the Mumbai civic body elections, former Mayor Shubha Raul on Sunday joined the BJP in the presence of Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis after resigning from the Uddhav Thackeray-led party.

title: Punjab AAP Sarpanch Shot In The Head At Amritsar Wedding Hall, Dies
content: A sarpanch from Punjab's ruling Aam Aadmi Party was shot dead at a wedding hall, the Marigold Resort, in Amritsar.

title: Bangladesh Cops Arrest 3 Accused In Murder Case Of Hindu Man Khokon Das
content: Bangladesh's elite force, the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) has arrested the three main accused in the murder of Khokon Das (50), a pharmacy owner and bKash agent from Shariatpur, Chief Adviser's Press Wing said on Sunday.

title: "Have you Seen Their Car?" Elon Musk's Mockery Of Chinese Rival BYD Backfires
content: Over a decade ago, a confident Elon Musk laughed dismissively when asked if Chinese automaker BYD could become a serious competitor to Tesla in the electric vehicle (EV) market.

title: 30 Killed, Many Kidnapped As Gunmen Attack Nigeria Market
content: At least 30 people were killed and several others abducted when gunmen attacked a market in Nigeria's Niger State, police said on Sunday.

title: The Significance Of Raj Thackeray's Homecoming After 2 Decades
content: Raj Thackeray was seen climbing the steps of Shiv Sena Bhawan today after nearly 20 years. He shared the stage with Uddhav Thackeray and Sanjay Raut.

title: "I Settled Eight And One-Quarter Wars": Trump After Maduro Op
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday (local time) said that he has managed to settle several global conflicts, claiming he resolved "eight and one-quarter wars," including easing tensions between Thailand and Cambodia.

title: A History Of US-Led Regime Changes And Their Disastrous Consequences
content: President Trump openly celebrated what he described as a flawless US military operation in Venezuela, which included an assault involving special forces, air strikes, and naval deployments that culminated in the seizure of Nicolas Maduro.

title: Trump's Plan To Seize, Revitalise Venezuela's Oil Industry Can Take Years
content: President Donald Trump's plan to take control of Venezuela's oil industry and ask American companies to revitalise it after capturing President Nicolas Maduro in a raid isn't likely to have a significant immediate impact on oil prices.

title: Serious Encroachment: North Korea Condemns US Capture Of Venezuela's Maduro
content: North Korea denounced on Sunday the United States' capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro as a "serious encroachment of sovereignty", state media said.

title: Raj Thackeray Enters Sena Bhavan After 20 Years As Maharashtra Politics Changes Again
content: Raj Thackeray entered the Shiv Sena Bhavan after 20 years. It's the same place where he once held sway.

title: New Buddhist Outfit In Ladakh Aims To Reshape Talks With Centre For Rights
content: The political churn in Ladakh has taken a new turn with the formal launch of the Voice of Buddhist Ladakh (VBL), a socio-political platform that is expected to recalibrate the region's engagement with the Union Ministry of Home Affairs.

title: US Was Ready For Venezuela Strike Before Christmas. What Delayed It
content: Months of planning and rehearsal, over 150 defence assets and a team with its eyes trained on the progress of 'Operation Absolute Resolve' looked to US President Donald Trump for a go-ahead, but weather played spoilsport.

title: Woman, Child Drown In Well In Jharkhand, Cops File Unnatural Death Case
content: A 25-year-old woman and her infant daughter allegedly drowned in a well in Jharkhand's Deoghar, police said on Sunday. The incident took place in Padmapur village.

title: 'Trump Will Remove Him': Shamans Predicted Maduro's Fall 5 Days Ago
content: Deposed Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro was captured in an audacious nighttime military operation that Donald Trump said would set the US up to "run" the South American country and tap its vast oil reserves to sell to other nations.

title: Amit Shah To Visit Tamil Nadu In Push For BJP Ahead Of Polls
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah would be in poll-bound Tamil Nadu on a two-day visit, signalling a renewed push by the BJP to recalibrate its NDA strategy ahead of the crucial Assembly elections.

title: US Capture Of Maduro Will Not Impact India's Trade With Venezuela: Think Tank
content: The US-Venezuela conflict will have a negligible impact on India's trade with the South American country, think tank GTRI said on Sunday.

title: Venezuela Has World's Largest Oil Reserve. How US Action Affects Markets
content: It's about oil, US President Donald Trump said quite frankly a day after US special forces captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and wife Cilia Flores from Caracas in a swift nighttime raid.

title: US Venezuela Attack LIVE: India Appeals To Address Venezuela Issue "Peacefully Through Dialogue"
content: US Strikes on Venezuela and Captured Maduro LIVE Updates: Vice President Delcy Rodriguez will assume the role of acting president of the country in the absence of Nicolas Maduro.

title: Last-Minute Call Saves Karnataka Infant From Being Sacrificed For 'Treasure'
content: A pit was dug inside a house in Karnataka and rituals were underway, when officials burst in and saved a one-year-old boy from being sacrificed in pursuit of a treasure.

title: Delhi blast: Probe unveils how terrorists spoke to Pak handlers - What's 'ghost' SIM card?
content: The “white-collar” terror module began to unravel on the intervening night of October 18-19, 2025, when posters of the banned Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) appeared on walls outside Srinagar city, warning of attacks on police and security forces in the Valley. A large cache of arms and ammunition, including 2,900 kg of ammonium nitrate, potassium nitrate and sulphur, was seized during the operation, officials said.

title: US grip on Venezuelan oil could help India recover $1bn dues, revive stalled output
content: A US-led takeover of Venezuela's oil sector could significantly benefit India, potentially recovering nearly $1 billion in long-pending payments and reviving crude production from fields operated by Indian firms.  With US sanctions eased, ONGC Videsh Ltd could restart operations at the San Cristobal oilfield, boosting output and allowing for the recovery of dues.

title: Marble deals, social posts & Maduro's capture: A Trump holiday like no other
content: President Trump concluded his Florida holiday with a surprise military raid in Venezuela, capturing President Maduro. This dramatic operation unfolded amidst a schedule filled with personal pursuits, including inspecting marble for a White House ballroom and attending social events. The swift action, planned during his break, highlights a stark contrast between his public and private activities.

title: 'Safety concerns': What Bangladesh said on not touring India for T20 World Cup
content: The matter was discussed following Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman’s exit from the Indian Premier League (IPL). BCB directors had earlier held an online meeting on Saturday night to deliberate on the issue.

title: 'Rectify the glitches, or ...': CM Mamata writes to CEC; urges to stop 'unplanned' Bengal SIR
content: Mamata Banerjee called the exercise "unplanned, arbitrary and adhoc" and urged the poll body chief to stop the SIR if glitches remain unattainted. In November last year, describing the ongoing SIR in West Bengal as “unplanned, chaotic, and dangerous,” Mamata Banerjee said that the situation had reached an “alarming stage” following the deaths of multiple booth-level officers (BLOs), including an anganwadi worker in Jalpaiguri.

title: America will ‘collapse’: Elon Musk’s father warns; cites population shift
content: Errol Musk, father of Tesla CEO Elon Musk, has sparked controversy with remarks predicting a US 'collapse' due to the white population becoming a minority within two decades. He also downplayed systemic oppression in South Africa, claiming white populations significantly contributed to Black African development.

title: 'Exact opposite': US secretary of war contrasts Venezuela mission with 2003 Iraq war
content: US Secretary of War Pete Hegseth declared Washington's swift operation in Venezuela, capturing President Maduro, a stark contrast to the Iraq invasion. He emphasized no prolonged conflict or American casualties, highlighting strategic action for resource access and national benefit.  President Trump announced plans for US oil companies to rebuild Venezuela's infrastructure, promising peace and prosperity.

title: Rice production: India overtakes China as top global producer; output hits 150mn tonnes
content: India has become the world's largest rice producer, surpassing China with an output of 150.18 million tonnes. This achievement follows the release of 184 new high-yielding, climate-resilient crop varieties developed by ICAR. The nation is now a global food provider with adequate foodgrain stocks.

title: Trump says US to 'run' Venezuela, tap its crude: Why it won't matter for India's oil bill
content: US President Donald Trump has said America is taking temporary control of Venezuela, aiming to tap its vast oil reserves. Despite holding the world's largest crude reserves, Venezuela's oil output is unlikely to see a significant boost for years due to political instability and decaying infrastructure. India's exposure remains minimal due to low trade and diversified sourcing.

title: China's DeepSeek returns: Proves cheaper AI works again; Silicon Valley shaken
content: Chinese AI firm DeepSeek unveiled a groundbreaking training method, "Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections," potentially slashing AI development costs. This innovation challenges the notion that advanced AI necessitates massive computing power, following their previous success with the R1 model. The breakthrough intensifies industry debates on scaling AI, with expectations high for DeepSeek's next model release.

title: ‘Brought embarrassment on us’: Tharoor on B'desh refusing to play in India
content: Bangladesh has asked the ICC to shift its T20 World Cup matches out of India after fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman was released from the IPL on BCCI advice. Citing player safety, the BCB refused to travel to India. Shashi Tharoor called the situation embarrassing, while Bangladeshi officials warned against disrespect amid strained bilateral ties.

title: Warren Buffett's biggest tech regret: Missing Google's IPO; invests after 21 yrs
content: Warren Buffett and the late Charlie Munger finally ended their decades-long regret by acquiring a $4.3 billion stake in Alphabet, Google's parent company, in Q3 2025. This move, driven by firsthand experience of Google's advertising prowess through GEICO, signals Berkshire Hathaway's growing confidence in Alphabet's AI ambitions and its core search business.

title: CIA in Caracas, source close to Maduro: The planning behind 'flawless' op Absolute Resolve
content: US special forces, after months of intelligence gathering and rehearsals, executed a pre-dawn raid to capture Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. The operation, named 'Absolute Resolve,' involved a covert CIA entry, drone surveillance, and detailed military planning, culminating in Maduro's extraction to the United States to face drug trafficking charges.

title: Pa O’Dwyer, Ireland’s strongman and five-time national champion, dies at 40
content: Patrick “Pa” O’Dwyer died suddenly at age 40, leaving the strongman world in shock. The Irish champion won Ireland’s Strongest Man five times and inspired many online. Known for his humor and honesty, he was also a devoted father. Tributes from athletes and fans continue to pour in worldwide.

title: 'Shame on us': John Abraham reacts to Indian football crisis
content: Indian football faces a crisis as players, including Sunil Chhetri, appeal to FIFA for intervention due to the suspended Indian Super League.  John Abraham calls the situation a "shame."  Uncertainty over the Master Rights Agreement has halted the 2025-26 season, with players warning of "permanent paralysis." The AIFF plans to announce a new start date next week.

title: York family net worth: How a $13M bet became the 49ers’ $8.4B empire
content: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.

title: Magic Johnson & Cookie Johnson 2025 net worth: Earnings and endorsements
content: NBA legend Magic Johnson and his wife, Cookie, boast a combined net worth of $1.6 billion. Magic's fortune stems from his basketball career and a vast business empire, including stakes in the Los Angeles Dodgers. Cookie has carved her own path as a successful author and entrepreneur, contributing significantly to their wealth and advocating for AIDS awareness.

title: Brittany Mahomes shares New Year glimpse as Patrick Mahomes continues rehab
content: Patrick Mahomes is entering 2026 focused entirely on rehab after suffering ACL and LCL tears late in the season. A New Year post from Brittany Mahomes confirmed he is still on crutches, reinforcing the long road ahead. Andy Reid stressed patience, noting Mahomes remains around the team while prioritizing recovery over travel or timelines.

title: 'Come get me, don't be late': White House shares Maduro's old clip daring Trump — watch
content: The clip details a US military operation, "Operation Absolute Resolve", carried out on Janaury 3 to capture Maduro in Caracas after a "large-scale strike."  The video depicts a video montage of night-vision footage and official briefings by Trump and other US officials. "​Nicolas Maduro had his chance — until he didn’t. The Trump Admin will always defend American citizens against all threats, foreign and domestic," the White House posted on X.

title: 'Take care of yourself': Kolkata cabby ensures drunk passenger reaches home safely on Christmas Eve — watch
content: A Kolkata cab driver's act of kindness, helping an intoxicated woman home on Christmas Eve, went viral, garnering thousands of likes.  Munna Ajij Mollick ensured the passenger's safety, even contacting her mother and assisting her inside.  This simple display of humanity resonated widely, overshadowing his previous social media efforts.

title: 'Law of Jungle': Tharoor, Shaina NC & more speak on Venezuela crisis; what they said
content: Senior Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor and Abhishek Manu Singhvi condemned the US airstrikes on Venezuela, calling it "law of the jungle" and "19th-century imperialism." Meanwhile, AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi drew a parallel to India, prompting sharp retorts from BJP and Shiv Sena leaders. India's Ministry of External Affairs expressed deep concern and urged peaceful resolution.

title: Mustafizur row: B'desh not to travel to India for T20 World Cup; did Yunus govt 'intervene'?
content: The issue was discussed in the backdrop of Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman’s exclusion from the Indian Premier League (IPL). BCB directors had earlier held an online meeting on Saturday night to discuss the matter.

title: Watch: Youth’s 'bonnet navigation' goes viral; internet cheers 'new feature'
content: North India's dense winter fog has led to a viral video showcasing an ingenious solution for navigating zero visibility. A man perched on a car's bonnet guides the driver with hand signals, turning a perilous drive into an improvised navigation exercise. This creative approach, dubbed 'ADAS Level 4,' has amused netizens and highlighted the resourcefulness of Indian youth.

title: Hijab row to postgrad push: Mangaluru student’s trek back to classroom; 6 friends quit in 5th sem
content: A student who left her undergraduate studies due to the 2022 hijab row has successfully completed her postgraduate degree in medical physics with a CGPA over 8. Gousiya, who took a year-long break, is now interning at an oncology institute and aims to become a radiation safety officer, demonstrating resilience and academic achievement.

title: Venezuelan President Maduro flashes peace sign while in custody — watch
content: Nicolas Maduro, Venezuela's former leader, has been seen in US custody. Videos show him arriving in New York City and being escorted by law enforcement. President Donald Trump announced the arrest following a military action. Maduro faces US drug-trafficking charges and is being held at MDC Brooklyn. The United States plans to oversee Venezuela's transition.

title: Fans react as Tom Brady parties with DiCaprio on yacht amid Alix Earle buzz
content: Tom Brady kicked off 2026 in St. Barts, first seen at a New Year's Eve party with influencer Alix Earle. The next day, photos emerged of Brady partying on a yacht with Leonardo DiCaprio and his girlfriend, Vittoria Ceretti, adding to pop culture speculation.

title: 'Pinpoint' planning: How Maduro, his wife were captured from ‘highly guarded fortress’ — key details
content: United States forces launched pre-dawn airstrikes in Venezuela, leading to the capture of President Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores.  Confirmed by President Trump, the operation involved elite Delta Force units and resulted in Maduro's transfer to US custody in New York.  Charges of narco-terrorism and drug trafficking have been filed against the couple.

title: Cigarette tax hike: Experts warn of surge in illicit trade; fear major revenue losses
content: Experts warn that a significant tax hike on cigarettes, coupled with a new excise duty structure, could fuel illicit trade and lead to substantial revenue losses for the government. This unexpected increase, raising overall taxes by 60-70%, risks pushing consumers towards smuggled products, as India already faces a substantial illicit tobacco market.

title: While corporate India talks 70-hour weeks, Bill Gates says AI could cut work to two days
content: As business leaders like Narayana Murthy argue for 70-hour workweeks, Bill Gates offers a sharply different vision, predicting that artificial intelligence could reduce work to just two days a week. The debate exposes a deeper clash over productivity, automation, and whether technological progress will free workers’ time or intensify expectations in the years ahead.

title: 'Only after Kohli and Rohit retire': Ashwin makes bold Gaikwad claim
content: Ruturaj Gaikwad was left out of India’s ODI squad for the New Zealand series despite scoring a century against South Africa. Selectors chose Rishabh Pant instead, mainly due to his left-handed option. Ravichandran Ashwin questioned the decision, praised Ruturaj’s batting ability, and admitted opportunities may remain limited until senior players retire.

title: ‘Foul-smelling, discoloured’: Sewage in drinking water triggers Indore-like scare in Bengaluru
content: The community of KSFC Layout is currently under siege from a major drinking water crisis stemming from sewage contamination, forcing residents to rely on private sources for more than a week.

title: Maha civic polls row: Uddhav Thackeray demands cancellation of unopposed wins; alleges ‘mobocracy’, Rs 3 lakh crore BMC scam
content: Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray have joined forces, demanding the cancellation of unopposed civic election wins, alleging democracy is being replaced by 'mobocracy'. Thackeray accused the ruling parties of a Rs 3 lakh crore BMC scam and 'stealing votes'. CM Fadnavis dismissed the claims as excuses, stating people's mandate prevails.

title: 'Historic leadership': Netanyahu congratulates Trump on Venezuela operation
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu congratulated President Donald Trump on the US military operation that captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife. Trump described watching the raid live, calling it a "brilliant operation." The US plans to take control of Venezuela's oil reserves and encourage investment to rebuild the industry.

title: 22-year-old stabbed to death after objecting youths harassing woman; CCTV captures attack
content: A 22-year-old man was fatally stabbed in Vidisha after intervening in the harassment of a young woman. The incident, captured on CCTV, saw the victim attacked by a group of youths he had previously confronted. Police are identifying the accused based on footage and have registered a murder case.

title: 'I thought I wasn't qualified ': Google engineer reveals what helped his career
content: Emrick Donadei, a software engineer at Google, transitioned into AI safety by participating in company hackathons.  These events provided him with exposure to new tools and decision-makers, bridging the gap between traditional engineering and large language models. His proactive approach demonstrated that active participation is key to entering the AI field.

title: Bangladesh announce T20 World Cup squad amid Mustafizur controversy
content: The BCB has been told by the sports ministry to request the relocation of Bangladesh’s T20 World Cup league matches from India to Sri Lanka due to “concerns about players’ safety” following Mustafizur Rahman’s ouster from the IPL on BCCI instructions.

title: Watch: 1st commercial validation flight lands at Bhogapuram airport; opening June 26 in Andhra
content: Bhogapuram Airport, India's second greenfield airport, achieved a significant milestone with its first commercial validation flight landing on Sunday. With 97% construction complete, the Alluri Sitarama Raju Greenfield International Airport is set to open on June 26, designed to withstand severe cyclonic conditions and handle six million passengers annually in its first phase.

title: Delhi man falls to death: 50-year-old dies at Le Meridien; probe underway
content: A 50-year-old man was discovered deceased after a fall from a height at the Le Méridien hotel in New Delhi on Tuesday afternoon. Initial police findings suggest the incident may be a suicide, with investigations ongoing to determine all circumstances surrounding the event.

title: 'Doors should not be closed': Agarkar questioned after Shami's ODI snub
content: Mohammed Shami’s international future has once again come under the spotlight after the 35-year-old was left out of India’s squad for the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand, announced on Saturday. The snub marks another setback for Shami, who has not represented India since being part of the Champions Trophy-winning squad in 2025.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office: Ranveer, Akshaye starrer crosses Rs 760 crore
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its reign as 2025's biggest hit, shattering box office records and dominating new releases. The film, starring Ranveer Singh and others, is on a record-breaking spree, aiming to challenge 'Pushpa 2's' domestic net collection. Meanwhile, 'Tu Meri Main Tera Tu Meri' and 'Ikkis' have seen moderate success.

title: 'Release them at once': China opposes US use of force in Venezuela; calls arrest of Maduro illegal
content: China has strongly condemned the US for allegedly capturing Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife, demanding their immediate release. Beijing termed the action a "large-scale strike" violating international law and Venezuela's sovereignty. China urged the US to cease its attempts to topple the government and instead pursue dialogue, highlighting the significant setback this poses to their strategic partnership.

title: Faridabad gangrape: Family says assault happened in ambulance; suspects tied to hospital
content: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly raped and brutalized inside an ambulance after accepting a lift in dense fog. Her family claims the two arrested suspects are ambulance workers and seeks financial aid for her extensive medical treatment. The victim sustained severe injuries and is awaiting a test identification parade.

title: CPCRI to celebrate 110th foundation day on Jan. 5
content: Established in 1916, ICAR-CPCRI has played a key role in advancing plantation crop research in the country, particularly in coconut, arecanut, cocoa and palmyrah

title: Minister lays foundation for Meyyur convention centre in Tiruvannamalai
content: The ₹4-crore facility will comprise an administrative office, a skill training hall, a computer lab, library, training rooms, an instructor’s office, and toilets. An event space capable of accommodating 400 people will be created

title: State to present strong case against expansion works of Polavaram Project by A.P.
content: Chief Minister Revanth Reddy and Minister for Irrigation Uttam Kumar Reddy hold discussions with Abhishek Singhvi on the State's stand in the case coming up in SC on Monday

title: Hike in tariff: seafood exports to U.S. drop by 25%
content: Andhra Pradesh, with its 974 km of coast, contributes over 32% of the total Indian seafood shipments; exporters scout for alternative markets in EU, China, Vietnam, Russia

title: Red Fort blast: Accused used ‘ghost’ SIM cards to communicate with Pakistani handlers
content: The outcome of the probe formed the basis for the DoT to issue a directive on November 28 last year, mandating that app-based communication services like WhatsApp be continuously linked to an active, physical SIM card within the device.

title: KC protests against Congress’ plan to take over Idukki seat
content: Such plans are being promoted by certain Congress leaders with ‘vested interests,’ says Kerala Congress district president M.J. Jacob

title: A.P. horticulture registers revival, contributes ₹1.52 lakh crore to GSDP
content: The Rayalaseema region continues to spearhead horticultural growth, with 7.8 lakh hectares under cultivation and a Gross Value Added (GVA) of ₹76,458 crore

title: Chicken traders in Kozhikode allege hoarding attempts
content: The traders call on the Civil Supplies department to carry out flash inspections of suspected poultry farms to expose the foul play

title: Thackeray cousins unveil BMC poll manifesto; promise free power sops for women
content: The manifesto was launched at the Shiv Sena Bhavan, prompting Raj Thackeray to visit the party headquarters for the first time in 20 years after he parted ways with the undivided Shiv Sena

title: Amidst split global opinion on Trump’s strike on Maduro, Modi government plays it safe
content: Cautious MEA statement in line with India’s recent positions on Ukraine, Gaza, Iran, say diplomatic experts; with India-U.S. trade deal negotiations at a crucial stage, Delhi likely to avoid strong protests

title: Army Chief General Dwivedi embarks on two-day visit to UAE
content: Gen. Dwivedi is scheduled to hold wide-ranging talks with top military brass of the influential Gulf nation

title: Preparations for Raichur Utsav under way
content: Ministers hold meeting with elected representatives and officials of the departments concerned in Raichur

title: Devotee groups flag neglect of Thiruvabharanam route
content: Proper maintenance of the historic 83-km stretch from Pandalam to Sabarimala crucial for the safety of barefoot pilgrims

title: Call for safety audit of stations under Southern Railway
content: The demand comes in the wake of a fire that destroyed around 500 motorcycles parked at Thrissur Railway Station on January 4 morning

title: Sankranti festive mood grips Chittoor, Annamayya districts
content: With ‘Bhogi’ set to be celebrated on January 14, followed by Sankranti and ‘Kanuma’, villages are caught in the grip of festive buzz rooted in agrarian culture

title: Successful validation flight at Bhogapuram airport a major milestone, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: It is expected to significantly strengthen regional connectivity and boost economic growth in the Uttarandhra region, he says

title: Unnatural death of woman: police probe suspected drug racket involvement
content: It was on December 31, 2025, that the 34-year-old woman, identified as Husna, was found dead in her flat at Kaithappoyil in Kozhikode

title: Consumer forum orders bank to pay compensation to complainant
content: The bank is said to have harassed the consumer asking him to pay service charges after issuing him three credit cards instead of one

title: Mamata urges ECI to halt SIR in West Bengal, warns of mass disenfranchisement
content: Mamata Banerjee expresses “grave concern” over alleged irregularities, procedural violations and administrative lapses in the conduct of the SIR in West Bengal

title: Centre will allow multiple airports in major cities, says Civil Aviation Minister Rammohan Naidu
content: In view of increased air passenger traffic across the country, the Union government will review the policy that bars two airports in a radius of 150 km, says Rammohan Naidu, expressing the hope that the Alluri Sitharama Raju International Airport at Bhogapuram will strengthen trade, boost exports and unlock the tourism potential of Andhra Pradesh

title: Congress’s Adhir meets Bengali migrant workers, expresses concern over 'parallel policing'
content: The former Congress leader in the Lok Sabha said that he has raised the issue with Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Udayagiri MLA denies woman’s allegations, alleges conspiracy
content: Kakarla Suresh rejects claims of unpaid work and promise of an MLA seat, alleges a conspiracy by rivals and says he will take the issue to the notice of the Chief Minister

title: PGRS expanded to mandal, divisional, municipal levels, announces Eluru Collector
content: The move aims to ensure faster resolution of public grievances and bring administration closer to the people, says  K. Vetriselvi

title: Our guide to every Week 18 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions and what's at stake
content: The Jaguars compete for a division title .. and the No. 1 seed. We have picks, predictions, stats and what's at stake for every game as the regular season reaches its finale.

title: Ravens-Steelers winner takes AFC North: 'This is going to be a slugfest'
content: For years, this feud has become must-watch TV, and Sunday won't be any different in a "winner-takes-all" game.

title: Seahawks silence 49ers, lock up NFC's No. 1 seed
content: In a performance that would make the Legion of Boom proud, the Seahawks kept the 49ers out of the end zone and won 13-3 to secure the NFC's No. 1 seed.

title: Playoff-hopeful Panthers, Bucs to root for rivals
content: The Panthers and Buccaneers have been forced into a peculiar situation, having to pull for different division rivals on Sunday for their team to win the NFC South title and a trip to the playoffs.

title: Sources: Buffs pick up receiving leader Scudero
content: San Jose State wide receiver Danny Scudero, the nation's leader in receiving yards this season, has committed to transfer to Colorado, sources told ESPN.

title: Rast ends Shiffrin winning streak in WC slaloms
content: Swiss skier Camille Rast has ended Mikaela Shiffrin's six-race winning streak in World Cup slaloms, beating the American star at a race in Slovenia as their duel shapes up nicely for the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics.

title: CMC owns key drop; 49ers lament missed chances
content: Christian McCaffrey owned a bobbled pass that turned into a game-sealing interception, saying it was a play he had to make. The 49ers were unable to make several key plays in their 13-3 loss to the Seahawks.

title: Amid boos, Baylor's Nnaji debuts in loss at TCU
content: James Nnaji, the 7-foot center and 2023 NBA draft pick whose signing drew criticism from coaches across college basketball last month, debuted with five points and four fouls in Baylor's 69-63 loss to TCU in the Big 12 opener for both teams.

title: Draymond ejected again; 'we need him,' Kerr says
content: Warriors forward Draymond Green was ejected for the second time in two weeks after arguing with officials over an uncalled three-second violation against the Jazz.

title: Smith sets Big Ten assists record, eyes D-I mark
content: No. 5 Purdue guard Braden Smith became the Big Ten's career assists leader, passing Cassius Winston, in an 89-73 win over Wisconsin.

title: 🏈 NFL playoff scenarios: How teams can clinch

title: Seahawks silence 49ers' offense in Week 18, win NFC's No. 1 seed
content: the Seattle Seahawks are heading to the playoffs as the NFC's no. 1 seed . the conference's top seed on the line, Mike Macdonald's team grounded and pounded its way to a 13-3 victory . in a battle of the NFL's second-best scoring defense, the seahawks won out .

title: Testing grit and willpower with 7 marathons, 7 continents in 7 days
content: WOLF's FANG RUNWAY in Antarctica ranks among the most desolate, unwelcoming places on the planet . 54 runners stepped off their charter plane on Nov. 16 and steeled themselves for the 26.2 miles of marathon hell ahead . the race took them in a matter of hours from the lung-freezing cold of Antarctica to the 94-degree heat of Perth, Australia .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance, more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .

title: No NFC South champ until Sunday after Bucs beat Panthers
content: the Tampa Bay Buccaneers beat the Carolina Panthers 16-14 to win the NFC South . if the Saints defeat the Falcons on Sunday, the Bucs would secure the division at 8-9 . it would mark the first time a team has won five straight division championships since 2002 .
